channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Lectures in History
channel.desc: On September 14, 1847, Winfield Scott's Army marched into Mexico City, marking the final stages of the Mexican-American War. University of Texas professor Aaron O'Connell chronicles the war's causes, the divisions it inflamed, and its aftermath.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This educational film demonstrates how viruses are spread through carelessness, and how colds can be avoided and treated.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: The Presidency
channel.desc: The Trump administration recently declassified papers held in the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Collection. Historian Fred Logevall talks with JFK library director Alan Price about what these records reveal of Cold War intelligence.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This 1943 War Department film instructs on how to tell the difference between the American P-40 fighter plane and the Japanese Zero fighter plane.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Douglas Branson, author of Washington's Lieutenants, discusses generals who served under George Washington during the Revolutionary War. The event was held at the American Revolution Institute in Washington, DC.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: C-SPAN Tours Milton Hershey Museum
channel.desc: C-SPAN tours the Hershey Story Museum in Hershey, Pennsylvania, which details the life, legacy, and chocolate of Milton Hershey.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Author James Dodson discusses the 800-mile long Great Wagon Road that became colonial America's primary road in the mid-1700s and facilitated the mass migration of European settlers to Maryland, Virginia, and the Carolinas.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: The Civil War
channel.desc: Author Robert Watson talks about the Civil War during the summer of 1864, and the near invasion of Washington, D.C., by Confederate forces.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This 1967 NASA film describes how NASA photographed the Moon for exploration. Reel America is an American History TV series featuring 20th century archival films.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: C-SPAN Tours Milton Hershey Museum
channel.desc: C-SPAN tours the Hershey Story Museum in Hershey, Pennsylvania, which details the life, legacy, and chocolate of Milton Hershey.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Scott Stephenson, president of the Museum of the American Revolution in Philadelphia, talks about General George Washington's Revolutionary War tent, which is part of the museum's collections.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Author Christopher Minty talks about the organization and political culture of loyalists in New York during the lead up to the American Revolution.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US

channel.desc: Douglas Branson, author of Washington's Lieutenants, discusses generals who served under George Washington during the Revolutionary War. The event was held at the American Revolution Institute in Washington, DC.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: American History TV
channel.desc: Airing weekends, "American History TV" offers programming about people and events that document the American story, geared toward history aficionados. Shows that air under the "American History TV" banner cover the history of the nation, from its founding in the 18th century through modern times. Topics covered include the Civil War, presidents and the exploration of historical sites.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Michael Mann & Peter Hotez, Science Under Siege
channel.desc: Scientists Michael Mann and Peter Hotez argue there's a growing anti-scientific movement promoted by scammers and dark money. Politics and Prose in Washington, D.C., hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Lawrence Krauss, The War on Science
channel.desc: Theoretical Physicist Lawrence Krauss and contributors to the book he edited argue that ideologically motivated attacks are suppressing science and free speech. The American Enterprise Institute hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Stephen Grant, Mailman
channel.desc: Book TV presents coverage of the 2025 National Book Festival.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: William Lopez, Raiding the Heartland
channel.desc: Author William Lopez documents the Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) raids on small and rural towns - and the fallout for families and local economies.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Author Liz Pelly, Mood Machine & Author Ben Ratliff, Run the Song
channel.desc: Authors meet in Nashville to talk about topics ranging from Spotify to Jimmy Carter's church sermons to early Black fiddle and banjo music, and to the Grand Ole Opry and Johnny Cash.

channel.title: America's Book Club
channel.desc: Supreme Court Associate Justice Amy Coney Barrett joins host David M. Rubenstein to discuss her new book, her early life, and her view of the Constitution.

channel.title: The Treasures with Justice Amy Coney Barrett
channel.desc: Supreme Court Justice Amy Coney Barrett and America's Book Club host David M. Rubenstein view artificats from the Folger Shakespeare Library related to the law.

channel.title: Q & A
channel.desc: Barry Diller, author of "Who Knew" and former head of Paramount Pictures and 20th Century Fox, talks about his career in television and Hollywood, and about his personal life and longtime relationship with fashion designer Diane von Furstenberg.
